metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Related Work Title

metadata.value: Book was written in Louvain, Belgium in 1477 in Latin and Scots by Magnus Makculloch. Magnus was a Scottish student in Louvain and wrote in the book at various times during 1477, along with other members of his family. Magnus became clerk to the Archbishop Schevez and later transcribed two manuscripts of Fordun, which are also held by the University of Edinburgh. There are additional writings by a later hand on blank leaves and fly leaves, possibly from the early to mid 16th century, by a later owner, John Purde, who has signed some of them. These writings consist of three poems by Henryson and Dunbar. This book was acquired by Laing in 1854.
metadata.label: Provenance Notes

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477, f.161r
metadata.label: Repro Title

canvases.label: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477, f.162r

metadata.value: (Aristotle) Notes on his lectures on logic. (Makculloch) Writer - clerk of the diocese of Ross. (Prude) Owner and writer of early 16th century additions.
metadata.label: Production Notes

metadata.value: A page of Latin text in two columns below a large historiated initial. The initial is red and contains the figures of the Virgin Mary, clothed in a red dress and white cape and wearing a crown, holding the baby Jesus, clothed in white. In a circle around the initial is bold Latin text, beyond which is a decorative square. In each corner of the square there are circles containing winged creatures with scrolls, comprising (clockwise from top left corner): a hawk or eagle, an angel, a cow or goat, and a gryphon.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: G. Gregory Smith, Specimens of Middle Scots, p.lxvii note.,
metadata.label: Reference

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of Latin text in two columns below a large historiated initial. The initial is in black ink with some red highlights and is surrounded by a circle of bold Latin text. This circle is enclosed by a square with decorative patterns. In the upper corners of the square are two shields with two bearded men in them. At the top of the page is a later inscription by David Laing.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of Latin text in two columns below a large historiated initial. The text is in black ink with red highlights. The initial is in red and black ink, and is surrounded by a square of bold Latin text. In each corner of the square is a shield. In the lower two shields are the faces of bearded men. In the upper two sheilds there is a red lion rampant on a white background (left) and three red fleur de lis on a black backround (right). Both of these upper shields are topped with crowns.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: A page of Latin text in two columns below a large histoiated initial. The text is in black ink while the initial is red. There is some water damage or smearing to the red ink of the initial. The initial is surrounded by a circle of bold Latin text. This circle is in turn surrounded by a square, patterned in a somewhat floral manner.

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of Latin text in black ink in two columns below a large historiated initial. The initial is in red and black ink, beyond which is a red square border surrounded by bold black Latin text. There are four shields in both the inner border and outer border. Those in the outer border are all topped with crowns. The shields in the inner border, clockwise from top left, are: the face of a bearded men with a pattern of red dots over it, a ship with three fleur de lis above it, red and white stripes, and a building on a background of blue. The shields in the outer border in the same order are as follows: a red lion rampant on a yellow background, three fleur de lis on a blue background, a crest with two red rampant lions and a number of fleur de lis, and a crest with six red lions and six fleur de lis.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Related Work Title

metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: (Aristotle) Notes on his lectures on logic. (Makculloch) Writer: clerk of the diocese of Ross. (Prude) Owner and writer of early 16th century additions.
metadata.label: Production Notes

metadata.value: A page of two columns of Latin text below a large historiated initial. The initial is in red and blue and is surrounded by bold Latin text in the shape of a diamond. On each corner of the shape is a different winged creature bearing a scroll. Clockwise from the top left corner, the creatures are: an angel, an eagle or hawk, a cow, and a gryphon. The top two scrolls bear the name of the person who wrote the book.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: G. Gregory Smith, Specimens of Middle Scots, p.lxvii note.,
metadata.label: Reference

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of two columns in black ink of Latin text below a large historiated initial, also in black. Two words in the right hand column of the text are larger than the others, and the text has some sort of brown wash on it. The initial is made up of complex patterns including knotwork. The initial is surrounded by a circle of bold Latin text, beyond which is a square with further complex patterns.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477

metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of two columns of Latin text in black ink below a large historiated initial, also in black. Two of the words in the right hand column of text are larger than the others. The initial is made of complex knotwork and is surrounded by a square of bold Latin text. In each corner of the square is a shield. The patterns of the shields are as follows, clockwise from top left: a lion rampant (shield topped with crown), three fleur de lis (shield topped with crown), the bust of a bearded man in a black hat, and a crest containing a lion rampant and a number of fleur de lis.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of text in two columns in black ink, featuring a large rubricated initial in the left hand column. The initial is surrounded by a square of bold Latin text. At each corner of the square is a shield; the designs of the shields (clockwise from top left) are a lion rampant, the bust of a bearded man with a crown, one horizontal bar through the centre, and several vertical bars. There are three words in the right hand column that are larger and bolder than the others.
metadata.label: Description

Two words in the right hand column of text are picked out larger and bolder than the others.

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of two columns of Latin text in black ink, above which is a large historiated initial in red and black. The initial is embellished with flourishes, and a crowned shield bearing a red lion rampant is at its centre. The initial is surrounded by a circle of bold black Latin text, beyond which are six shields. Clockwise from top left, the patterns on the shields are: a black two-headed eagle, blank, blank, crowned with three fleur de lis, the bust of a bearded man in a black hat, and a circular pin. One word in the right hand column of text is picked out as larger and bolder than the rest.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of two columns of Latin text in black. A large black historiated initial is above the left hand column, decorated with a number of flourishes. The initial is surrounded by bold black Latin text, with a face in each of its four corners. Clockwise from the top left, the faces are a lady with long hair in a patterned hat, a bearded man in a hat possibly with a halo, a long haired bearded man in a turban, and a clean shaven man. One word in the left hand column and three words in the right hand column are picked out as larger and bolder than the rest of the text. There has been some damage to the page, and the lower right corner is missing, removing the end of 13 lines of text.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: (Aristotle) Notes on his lectures on logic. (Makculloch) Writer: clerk of the diocese of Ross. (Prude) Owner and writer of early 16th century additions.
metadata.label: Production Notes

metadata.value: A page of various textual and pictoral elements in black and red ink. In the centre of the page is a single column of text in Scots, which has some sort of a brown wash over it. To the left of, and partially behind, the text is a full-body figure of a man in fabulous clothes, consisting of tights, a short partially red tunic with a complicated pattern, and a wide-brimmed hat with a feather. He faces left and carries a branch or stick in one hand. One short line of text is written to the right of the figure. Further to the right are two more short lines of text, beyond which is a drawing of a stick or staff mounted with two coats of arms in red and black ink. The top coat of arms is topped with a crown and contains a red lion rampant. The lower coat of arms is the bust of a bearded man in a hat topped with red and a red shirt.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: G. Gregory Smith, Specimens of Middle Scots, p.lxvii note.,
metadata.label: Reference

metadata.value: Lectura super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera. Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach [Makculloch MS]
metadata.label: Related Work Title

metadata.value: Book was written in Louvain, Belgium in 1477 in Latin and Scots by Magnus Makculloch. Magnus was a Scottish student in Louvain and wrote in the book at various times during 1477, along with other members of his family. Magnus became clerk to the Archbishop Schevez and later transcribed two manuscripts of Fordun, which are also held by the University of Edinburgh. There are additional writings by a later hand on blank leaves and fly leaves, possibly from the early to mid 16th century, by a later owner, John Purde, who has signed some of them. These writings consist of three poems by Henryson and Dunbar. This book was acquired by Laing in 1854.
metadata.label: Provenance Notes

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477, f.87v
metadata.label: Repro Title

canvases.label: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477, f.89v

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of two columns of Latin text in black ink. Above the left hand column is a large black historiated initial, decorated with a number of flourishes. Around the initial is a square of bold black Latin text. At each corner of the square is a shield, the patterns of which (clockwise from top left) are as follows: the bust of a bearded man with curly hair, a circular pin, three cross crosslet fichys around a chevron, and a number of stars on a saltire. Above the initial are a number of flourishes or pen trials in black ink that appear to be contemporary. One word in the left hand column and three words in the right hand column are picked out as larger and bolder than the others.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477

metadata.value: Lectura Super Logicalia Aristotelis Petri de Mera, Andree de Alchmaria, Theodrici Meysach, 1477
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of Latin text in black ink in two different hands. There are also a number of pen trials or doodles throughout the page, including a number of outlines of fleur de lis. At the bottom of the page, the outline of a figure of a man from the thighs up wearing a round cap and apparently holding a shield on which is the face of a bearded man, also in a hat.
metadata.label: Description
